conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: extruded walls with thickness, visible floor plane, angled/isometric viewpoint, and ceiling/roof removed to expose interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; perspective is appropriately angled with minimal distortion; cutaway is clean with continuous wall geometry and exposed interiors.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency largely match (kitchen/dining left, living central, bedrooms right, bath near center/bottom). Some proportional/layout deviations appear around the hall/bath/closet partitions and doorway placements compared to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures present (dining set, living seating, bed, bathroom fixtures). Laundry/closet elements are simplified and not as explicitly represented as in the 2D plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors/openings are visually distinct and readable; lighting supports visibility; no obvious broken meshes. Presentation is clean with no UI/text overlays in the 3D render.

detected_errors.description: Minor-to-moderate layout/proportion drift in the central circulation/bathroom/closet partitioning compared to the 2D plan.
Some door/opening placements and swing/orientation do not precisely match the 2D plan.
Laundry/closet-specific elements are simplified or not clearly distinguished as dedicated rooms.

summary: A valid and well-executed 3D cutaway that broadly preserves the 2D layout, with minor proportion and opening-placement mismatches in the central partition areas.
